questions.question: Which of the following best defines a DBMS?
options: A system to store and manage data

questions.question: Which DBMS type allows flexible schema and horizontal scaling?
In an ERD, a weak entity is identified by:
Which of the following is TRUE about a conceptual model?
options: It contains table names and columns
It is technology-independent and shows entities and relationships
It is used to define physical storage

questions.question: Which SQL command belongs to DDL?
What will the following query do? SELECT DISTINCT dept_id FROM employee;
Which anomaly occurs when deleting a row unintentionally removes important data?
A relation is in 1NF if:
Which of the following violates 2NF?
options: Non-key attribute depends only on part of composite key

questions.question: Which normal form removes transitive dependency?
Which join returns all rows from both tables including unmatched rows?
What is the result of: SELECT 10/0;
Which clause filters groups created by GROUP BY?
Which MySQL engine supports transactions and foreign keys?
In the query: SELECT * FROM emp WHERE salary BETWEEN 20000 AND 40000; which values are included?
Which of the following will return employees with NULL department?
Projection in relational algebra means:
Which SQL query performs a Cartesian product?
options: SELECT * FROM A NATURAL JOIN B;

questions.question: AUTO_INCREMENT applies to which type of column?
Which is TRUE about correlated subqueries?
options: Runs for each row of outer query
Does not depend on outer query

questions.question: Which command undoes only the last portion of a transaction?
A view that contains joins and aggregations is called:
Which privilege allows a user to create objects in a database?
Which index type improves range queries the most?
Which ACID property ensures data persists after commit?
Instance of a database means:
options: Actual stored data at a moment

questions.question: Which statement is used to create a stored procedure?
OUT parameter in a stored procedure is used to:
Which loop runs at least once in MySQL stored routines?
ITERATE keyword in MySQL is similar to:
Which built-in function returns the current date?
A cursor in MySQL is:
options: A pointer to row-by-row result processing

questions.question: Which trigger fires after a row is inserted?
OLD values are accessible in which trigger?
Which of the following is NOT allowed inside a function?
Cross join between 5-row table A and 3-row table B returns:
Which constraint ensures uniqueness but allows NULL values?
Which SQL query copies table structure only?
options: CREATE TABLE new AS SELECT * FROM old;
INSERT INTO new SELECT * FROM old;

questions.question: Which of the following is TRUE about EXISTS?
options: Returns TRUE if subquery returns at least one row

questions.question: Which of the following best describes BCNF?
options: Every determinant must be a candidate key
